org.openscience.cdk.smiles
Class SmilesParser

java.lang.Object
  org.openscience.cdk.smiles.SmilesParser

@TestClass(value="org.openscience.cdk.smiles.SmilesParserTest")
public class SmilesParser
extends java.lang.Object

Parses a SMILES [?Authors?, SMILES Tutorial] string and an AtomContainer. The full SSMILES subset [?Authors?, SSMILES Tutorial] and the '%' tag for more than 10 rings at a time are supported. An example: 

 try {
   SmilesParser sp = new SmilesParser(DefaultChemObjectBuilder.getInstance());
   IMolecule m = sp.parseSmiles("c1ccccc1");
 } catch (InvalidSmilesException ise) {
 }

This parser does not parse stereochemical information, but the following features are supported: reaction smiles, partitioned structures, charged atoms, implicit hydrogen count, '*' and isotope information.

See [Weininger, David, SMILES, a Chemical Language and Information System. 1. Introduction to Methodology and Encoding Rules, Journal of Chemical Information and Computer Sciences, 1988, 28:31-36] for further information.

Author:
Christoph Steinbeck, Egon Willighagen
Keywords:
SMILES, parser
Created on:
2002-04-29
Belongs to CDK module:
smiles
